page.title: 17RELIGION AROUND COALISLAND
page.content: This area is almost predominantly Roman Catholic. The children all attend local Catholic schools, first the {primary}from 4-11 years and then{ {St. Joseph's High School}in Coalisland or{St. Patrick's Academy}in Dungannon. There are no Catholic churches in the block but 3 are found just on the periphery of the area. The area takes in two{parishes- Clonoe}and{ {Coalisland}.Each parish is run by a Parish Priest and two{curates}. Many local groups eg.{St. Vincent de Paul {or Legion of Mary}are organised through the church. The 80 or so Protestant families are found almost exclusively in Ballynakilly or Newtownkelly. The majority belong to the Church of Ireland with one local Rector and a few are Presbyterian or Methodist. (ctd page 18)
